Upcoming Tests
Math-  Topic 5 - Tuesday, Nov 11th
Grammar Workshop - Unit 2 - NOUNS (L9-14) - Thursday, Nov 13th

Reading

The definition Paper is for WEDNESDAY

The story this week is 'Weird Friends." 

Please watch the video until you understand the story.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZdYQdzhaurc

The spelling test is on  Friday!

predators
protection
immune
species
emerges
cluster
sea anemone
tentacles
rhino
egret
blind
antennae 
detect
flee
pod

Extra reading ( I have added some new stories)

TO IMPROVE READING AND EMBED LEARNING, YOU SHOULD BE LOGGING INTO READWORKS

Please go to ReadWorks and complete some of the stories assigned. They will help you with your work in school and also improve your overall reading.

Go to www.readworks.org/student 

Enter our class code YU6GQ2
Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it

Science

Hi everyone,

For homework, you need to complete the blank climate chart for the city Mr. Smith assigned today.

Instructions:

Go online (for example, https://en.climate-data.org/) and find:

The average temperature (°C) for each month
The average precipitation (mm) for each month
On your chart:
Draw a line graph for temperature
Draw a bar chart for precipitation
Use different colors for the line and bars to make it bright and clear

Label your axes and give your chart a title: “Climate of [City Name]”

Be creative — we will display your graphs in class

Remember: Check your data carefully for each month and do your best

Math (DUE MONDAY)
Tomorrow is the Topic 5 Math test -  Remember, the red assessment pages are very similar to the test.

Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night
 at https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9E to help strengthen their skills.

Korean (MONDAY)

Pages 154-159

Social Studies
Write and color the 2 facts about Ireland! Also, color the pictures also using green, white, and orange.

Please make sure you are working on your World Heritage Day – Ireland project. Discuss with your group and start generating fun and exciting ideas for your booth.

Your booth should have:

Something to teach (1–2 minutes)
An activity visitors can try (3–4 minutes)
Decide who will bring pictures, make materials, write, or decorate. Think carefully about your ideas and come to class ready to share them.

World Heritage Day is next  THURSDAY, so we need to be prepared and make our booths engaging for visitors.

If you plan to send a food donation, please send the letter by November 13th.

Language Arts

Grammar Workshop pages 68-69
